website_summaries.verdict: For consumers who use honey frequently, this large bottle and affordable price is a budget-friendly deal that's difficult to beat.
pros: bottle will last for a long time
Perfect for consumers who use a lot of honey, such as bakers and chefs
A good value for the price
cons: Customers have mixed opinions of the flavor – some love it, some say it's a bit "off."
A few bottles arrived with loose lids resulting in spilled honey

customer_reviews.title: Fermenting Less Than Local Honey
customer_reviews.text: I’m not convinced this is authentic honey. I’ve put this head to head with two local raw honeys. One in a traditional mead and the other in a cyser. In both, fermentation lacked severely compared to the others. It barely has made bubbles while the others have foamed heavily. The honey now seems sketchy to me and I don’t think I’ll be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Darland

customer_reviews.title: Very strong sweetness of sugar not authentic honey
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this one is a real honey but a sugar mixed with some honey. Very strong sweetness of sugar not authentic honey. This is a fake honey. Don't buy it. I will not buy this fake product again.
customer_reviews.author: kltv

customer_reviews.title: This is the best buy on here and over time has proven to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best buy on here and over time has proven to be well worth the purchase. Granted, it's not some posh and pricy 'MANUKA" OR "TEXAS WILD FLOWER" honey, but once it's in my tea I cannot taste the difference. It bakes well and is consistently crisp and flowery tasting and surprisingly clear for unboiled product. I've never detected them stretching their product with corn syrup as I have with some grocery shelf brands.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Great honey
customer_reviews.text: This honey has a great flavor and provides good flavors to a mead. I made a blueberry mead with this honey and it turned out really nice. I have seen some strange reviews with people saying this is cut with corn syrup, sugar, or something else because the honey didn't ferment in a mead, or was crystalized. Honey crystallizes, it's normal, and for meads not fermenting or tasting bad its probably the way you made your mead. Making a mead that is 20% is bound to taste aweful. Bottom line the honey tastes nice, I've used it, I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Afoekon

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a yummy supply of honey
customer_reviews.text: We’re a honey loving family. This is a great price for the amount of honey you get. The honey is mild tasting, and it has stayed clear and free flowing from start to finish. We’ll definitely be reordering this gem!
customer_reviews.author: Reasonable Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this honey to make mead and it's great. Best price so far and it's working beautifully. It tastes as good as any other honey. I'd eat it on toast.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: it has a good taste and the price is right
customer_reviews.text: it has a good taste and the price is right, I have re-ordered this many times, nothing negative to say about it, if you like honey you will like this.
customer_reviews.author: D. De Cicco

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor
customer_reviews.text: This has a really nice flavor. I did the "bread test" comparing this honey to the crystalized stuff in my kitchen that I know for a fact is real honey. There was no discernable difference between the two, so I think this is real. It does not have the over-smooth flavor of King syrup like the fake stuff does. I look forward to using it in the breads and other baked goods that I make and I will keep it on auto-delivery. It's a good deal, I shopped around. The only thing cheaper was way too light and suspicious looking. Update: The honey has crystalized 3/4 of the way and fake honey doesn't do that.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki L. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Not to my liking ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I've used this honey twice now in a hot tea... had to pour it out... the smell of the honey is off putting , but what's worse is that it taste exactly as it smell ... now I dont know what kind of honey this is ... it doesn't say .. ( clover, wild flower etc. ) so I dont know if it's suppose to taste like this... it also leaves a after taste.. Sorry but this is my personal evaluation .. someone else might like it....fyi I use honey everyday ....
customer_reviews.author: Terry Walker

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Horrible! Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered this several times. The flavor has never been great but ok. The most recent one had leaked in the box which means the seal must have broken. I didn’t think anything about it, which was stupid, but after using it in my oatmeal all week, I’ve been violently ill. It’s the only new thing I added to my diet. The one prior to that had black specks all in it. I should have learned then. I’ll be paying a little more from now on for quality honey.
customer_reviews.author: B Rose

customer_reviews.title: Not a good quality honey!
customer_reviews.text: This brand honey does not taste natural. Taste like sugar is mixed in it. I am curious which flower the honey comes from? The flavor honey should be on the label. I buy local honey in my neighborhood, and on the label it states Dark Wildflower or Orange Blossom etc. The label says "Natural," but I doubt it...
customer_reviews.author: SKS

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Enough For Tea
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleasantly surprised this Lake Shore honey is so sweet that I only need a level teaspoon to sweeten my tea, compared to a rounded teaspoon of sugar or a heaping teaspoon of Xylitol. I've been using Xylitol because it's supposed to be anti-cavity, but it's expensive so I was about to switch back to sugar, when I browsed across this honey. The Lake Shore is even costlier than the Xylitol, but so much healthier than any other sweetener, and I can save by needing less than other sweeteners. However I've also started using fluoride toothpaste for insurance.
customer_reviews.author: MysteryAuthor

customer_reviews.title: Lake Shore Honey
customer_reviews.text: Tastes wonderful to me and I use a lot of honey. More bang for your buck. Be careful buying honey, make sure you buy only in US. China has their hands in the global market and are cutting their honey with a rice offset.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this is truly honey after using it I found that it's has a bitter taste to it. Which made my wine have a bitter aftertaste to it
customer_reviews.author: rustman52

customer_reviews.title: Very EARTHY Mead
customer_reviews.text: It pours like honey, smells like honey but looks like molasses and has unpleasant off flavors associated with it. The mead it made was similar to the way it looked and smelled when it started. It did make a strong 20% drink, but its hard to get down because it just doesn't taste all that good. I gave it 3 stars because it might have other uses where the flavor doesn't matter as much, if it's primary use for for making honey wine, it would get one star. You are getting bulk commercial honey with a very earthy flavor.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rist

customer_reviews.title: A different kind of honey? Very dark, very thick...
customer_reviews.text: This honey is a bit strange. Not necessarily in a bad way, just a bit strange. When it arrived I found it interesting as it was quite a bit darker than any honey I've purchased in the past from Amazon or grocery stores. It has a sort of brown, almost caramel color. When I first poured it I was surprised at how thick it was. It hardly moves. It doesn't appear to be going to sugar, it's just really thick. The taste is a bit different from what I'm used to. Not bad, just different. Overall I'm not at all disappointed but also don't think I'll buy it on repeat. YMMV...
customer_reviews.author: Mark K.

customer_reviews.title: Not real honey.
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t taste good and seems to be cut with corn syrup.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Baber

customer_reviews.title: Why no lid?
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting to receive my honey, but I received my honey with out a lid on it. Like why? After I open it then what?
customer_reviews.author: T Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Yuck!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third time ordering this product. This time I did not get "pure, natural honey" they advertise. Buyer beware. It may be that resources are scare or the pandemic has caused them to add corn syrup to their product, BUT it has altered the flavor of all my green teas. I do not enjoy the tea anymore as there is the overpowering flavor of the honey--or whatever it is. Also, the viscosity is not indicative of honey. GROSS GROSS GROSS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Souza

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: There are no ingredients on the packaging whatsoever. It doesn't taste like honey, it tastes more like corn syrup. But for the price, I suppose I shouldn't have been surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Please don’t waist your money. It’s horrible.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst honey taste wise I’ve ever had. Unknowingly my brother also bought this honey and he said it was so horrible he threw it out. That’s exactly what I’m going to do.
customer_reviews.author: Fratt

customer_reviews.title: So sticky
customer_reviews.text: This clover honey is one of the better clover honeys out there. The price is great for the amount you get, flavor is on point, shipping is fast, and you get what you pay for...Honey. Note: This, like all honeys, has a stickiness that gets all over the place if you dont wash your hands after reaching in to grab some. Tip: pouring the honey into a rubber balloon and then throwing it at your wife is a neat little trick I learned with this honey.
customer_reviews.author: cw

customer_reviews.title: Great buy ignore those who rate bad read my review
customer_reviews.text: 2nd order. Great stuff yes its sweet! But honey is sugar. Will order again. Crazy reviews taste too much like sugar. Duh! It is, as that is what honey is. Also depends on what the bees get there sugar from. AKA Nectar! So many different types of honey based clearly on what they find to make it into honey. This is great stuff and I have bought 3 times now. Highly recommend! From corn fields to apple trees, all have different flavors and sweetness.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Mariner

customer_reviews.title: good souce of TASTY
customer_reviews.text: honey. to honey or not to honey, that would be an interesting question... biscuits, tea/coffee, cereal/oatmeal, sauces, there is a use for the bee's substance of flavor to be found, and Lake Shore has one tasty source. if you've tried various honeys and found some to be lighter, some to taste more like clove or orange blossom, or tried a comb variety, you might find the flavor of Lake Shore on the medium end of the spectrum, with a slight clove hint. very good. very good. two bees, or thumbs, up. I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great taste, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this. I have gotten multiple bottles and am coming back for more. It's a decent price and a great tasting product. There are some other honey sellers who have "better prices" but charge you for shipping so you actually end up paying more. I think I'll try some brewing with this since it has such a good flavor.
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuy

customer_reviews.title: Honey??
customer_reviews.text: This honey was watery and had no sweetness to it. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Ray and Kathie

customer_reviews.title: turned out pretty good. i tasted the honey and it tasted ...
customer_reviews.text: used to make mead. turned out pretty good. i tasted the honey and it tasted different from what im used to(store brand), but didnt taste bad just different.
customer_reviews.author: FiReWaTeR

customer_reviews.title: Where does this honey come from?
customer_reviews.text: The reason for the 3 star review is because nowhere on the label does it tell me where this honey is manufactured or that it is "true source certified." All it says is distributed by HoneyTree, Inc., Onstead, Michigan. Some international honey is diluted with corn syrup. I do not wish to purchase diluted honey.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not good for making mead
customer_reviews.text: I bought this honey to make mead. It tastes lackluster and ever so slightly medicinal. Can not recommend it for making mead or even as just table honey.
customer_reviews.author: S. Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Great Flavor and Value!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like my son consuming too much sugar, but sometimes he needs something sweet in his morning cereal, so I put a drizzle of honey on it. This honey tastes really good and he likes it. I like that it’s a natural sweetener. What I did with my honey since it’s in such a large container is just put a little hole in the foil seal in order to control the amount that pours out.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Waitman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: as advertised! UPDATE!! I put this in a cider I made. The cider turned out awesome! I did not go crazy with the honey! It was used instead of using sugar. Next time I use this it will be in a mead(yum)! The honey has a heavyer taste then I am used to(clover honey). But I think this honey would do just fine! Using another brand for this time around!, but feast a shore I will be using these guys again!
customer_reviews.author: Danny Panetta

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Love this honey! You truly can't beat this price. I frequently bake with natural sweeteners, and make homemade granola all the time for my hungry boys, so I go through a lot of honey. As a one income household, I couldn't afford to do so without buying in bulk! I was concerned about this not being 100% honey but it seems to be the real deal. I've ordered it twice now and I will keep coming back as long as the price does not inflate.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Rae

customer_reviews.title: NOT from LAKESHORE so gross!
customer_reviews.text: First thing- honey is NOT from the Lakeshore (MI). Stamped on the container it says product of AR - last I checked Arkansas isn't too close to MI. The flavor is disgusting- really wish I wasn't stuck with such a large container of this gross stuff😒.
customer_reviews.author: Hymn Lover

customer_reviews.title: Unique taste- Good
customer_reviews.text: This honey has a unique taste, I do not know what kind of pollen it is made with, it took my wife a couple of times tasting it to like it. This is not like store bought honey, it is not bland, it does not taste like it is factory produced.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: My Tea Likes It
customer_reviews.text: Tastes like real honey to me... no fillers. I was buying a 16oz bottle of honey, every two weeks. When I found this 5lb bottle, for under $20.00, I decided I would try it. I have refilled my 16oz bottle, 3 times, since I purchased this big size... still have almost 1/2 bottle to go. Great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The taste is fine but it seems to be watered down
customer_reviews.text: The taste is fine but it SEEMS to be watered down and not completely pure honey. It is affordable for a 5lb jug and a great alternative to sugar or corn syrup.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Prepare for a mess.
customer_reviews.text: My review is mostly about the shipping. The bottles were on their side, which normally wouldn't be a problem, but the caps were loose and there was no sealing under them, so the honey leaked all over the place and was dripping out of the box when I found it on my porch. It's a good thing that I chose 1-day shipping or I would have lost more than just a couple of ounces.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bong

customer_reviews.title: Good Taste At A Good Price
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased this brand & size of honey and I find it tastes very good and works for all my daily non-cooking uses as well as for all of my baking & cooking needs. I'll continue to purchase this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Cardinal53S

customer_reviews.title: Tasty honey for a great value!
customer_reviews.text: I go through a lot of honey and it can get really expensive, but I don't like some of the cheap kinds you can find, they taste weak or watered down... this is a delicious honey that is a great price, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: TheseAreTheGoodOldDays

customer_reviews.title: packaging is fair, price is fair and taste varied both times I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third set of orders. I am hoping it will be better than the second which was more like syrup, not so tasty and very light unlike my first order which was thick and really tasted like natural honey. The price is fair and I am hoping I get two thick and really good tasting natural honey. If not, this would be my last order ever. I am open to review my ratings if I get a good delivery of what I want.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Lake Shore Bulk Honey, 5 Lb
customer_reviews.text: Comes in a standard " half-gallon milk jug" plastic jug. Speedy shipping and a good price for honey. I use this primarily for #Jun fermented green tea however; I'll also be using it for Elderberry syrup the next time I make some.
customer_reviews.author: Alpacamade

customer_reviews.title: Has good flavour
customer_reviews.text: Nice colour to the honey and mid market taste. Its not as weak as supermarket brand honey but not as robust as raw unfiltered honey "middle of the market". Planning on using this for a "cyzer mead" recipe and feel it sould preform well for that intended purpose. Knowing it does not say raw or anything leading me to think its NOT processed to some extent with the flavour it has I say 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price per pound on the 5lb jug. This has a "different", mild taste...I'm used to alfalfa honey which is slightly stronger flavor. If you like clover and orange blossom honey I think you'll go nuts for this one...really good! Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.author: Richard A.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I stopped eating granulated bleached sugar, and am using honey exclusively in my tea and also yogurt. I needed a large quantity. This fit the bill. I was happy with the taste and value.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D.

customer_reviews.title: good price and product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good price and it is real honey. I would recommend transferring it to glass unless you are going to use it all in a short amount of time it makes it easier to melt it if it crystals up (which it hasn't yet) and plastic is no Bueno anyway.
customer_reviews.author: mrtdrew

customer_reviews.title: Sweet, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product, made the sweetest honey wine with it. Super great value and quick shipping. Only one tiny issue, jugs were on their side and leaked a little bit in the box. Now off to make a new batch of wine🙂
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Edmunds

customer_reviews.title: Sweet news for tea
customer_reviews.text: This honey sweetens my tea perfectly and seems to help clear up my allergic reactions based on the reduction in phlegm I experience when using this honey.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Only way to buy honey, delicious
customer_reviews.text: The bees would be so proud! Delicious and so handy. Very economical. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L Alley

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: Honey in bulk delivered to my door - Convenient! Because I always forget it at the store. I purchased months ago and we are still pouring. Tastes great!
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 gallons of mead!
customer_reviews.text: I am subscribed to get one of these a month. I make mead, and these 5 pounds are exactly the right amount for me to make a two gallon batch. The honey has a nice color and taste, and it gives a nice aroma once most of the sugar is fermented out!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Can you change your bottle design? Otherwise amazing honey at an Amazing price point
customer_reviews.text: Can you guys update the design of the bottle? At some point while I am using the honey over time, there becomes a sharp point in the bottle (upper back) which breaks into a small hole. This happens because the bottle does not go back to it's original shape but crumples in. Sometimes this makes the honey clump up - such a large quantity and small opening can make it hard to get it out..
customer_reviews.author: Tech-Know-Fab

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: It is value for money, as it is cheapest in the list. It doesnt "look" very presentable but the taste is okay I guess. I purchased this one and amazon brand honey before. they are similar.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Chan

customer_reviews.title: Southerners Won't Think This is Honey
customer_reviews.text: This just didn't seem like honey to me. It seems more like corn syrup with a slight honey flavor. It might be that I'm used to wildflower honey. I just wasn't pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mark James

customer_reviews.title: NOT 100% pure honey...
customer_reviews.text: NOT 100% pure honey... has corn syrup in it. Bought this to try and save money compared to local honey. No where on the packaging does it say 100% pure honey. Made identical batches of mead and this honey does not compare to the honey bought locally. Does not clear nor act like local pure honey either (in mead). Leaves a taste in your mouth not of pure honey... Not bad but NOT great. Good price however...
customer_reviews.author: J. Strauss

customer_reviews.title: Good Price and Delivery
customer_reviews.text: This Honey is part of my Emergency Supplies. I have no Idea of Taste or Quality. but I've never had a bad experience yet. It will be considerable time before I rotate thru this.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas.H.Williams

customer_reviews.title: very good. I eve use it to sweeten my coffee
customer_reviews.text: This honey is very, very good. I eve use it to sweeten my coffee! It pours smoothly and evenly. It is sweet, but not to the point of setting my teeth on edge. I found it a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Yuck. Yuck. Yuck.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what this is-it doesn't taste like any honey I've ever had. I tried to choke through to bottle but ended up throwing it away. It tastes like a bad molasses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality honey
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Used it to make homemade mead. Good flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Local honey at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Size was much smaller then I thought. My fault, won’t buy again
customer_reviews.author: Daniel laskowski

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I use honey every day along with turmeric for joint stiffness. This is the most reasonably priced quality honey I could find.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: A very good honey.
customer_reviews.text: I tasted side by side with my best priced market honey-very close in taste, nearly the same price. So Amazon will deliver this 5 lb jug with my order. I don’t run out as quickly.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Looks like honey
customer_reviews.text: I always worry when i buy cheep honey. Is it real honey or corn syrup? Well, i am not sure if this is 100% pure honey, but it tastes and looks/smells like honey. Great for tea and cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Yummy!
customer_reviews.text: I grabbed this to make some spicy honey and it worked out a lot better than the cheap clover honey from walmart. Not sure what kind of honey this is but it does taste better even before infusing it with peppers so I'll probably be getting this again when I run out.
customer_reviews.author: JessieTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: Possibly poisonous
customer_reviews.text: Almost immediately after eating a spoonful of this I experienced a harsh burning in my throat, followed by several hours of feeling very sick. I will be throwing this out and ordering a different brand's honey to replace it. The flavor isn't that great either.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Good tasting honey.
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy the taste of this honey. I use it to make mead or add it to my beer recipes
customer_reviews.author: Electronics guy

customer_reviews.title: Delicious.
customer_reviews.text: Delicious. Wonderful honey. I bought it for emergency preparedness, but had to sample it. I may buy more so I have some to eat and some to store.
customer_reviews.author: Russell F.

customer_reviews.title: A good source of fermentable sugar and flavor for home brew
customer_reviews.text: As a home brewer, I sometimes use honey to add flavor, aroma, and fermentable sugar to a brew. This, at the price I got it, was an inexpensive option to get five pounds of (what seems to be) good quality honey. I've already successfully brewed beer with some of it, and it turned out fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Salsbury

customer_reviews.title: Sweet, Dark Elixer of the Gods
customer_reviews.text: Make mead with this stuff and then go listen to Heilung while you drink. Maria Franz awaits!
customer_reviews.author: AnonZero

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for brewing.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. It has good consistency and flavor without being overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: Johanne-portrait artist

customer_reviews.title: I don't think it's all honey.
customer_reviews.text: Tastes really off and syrupy. Like if honey had its own type of molasses flavor. Not like any other nicer honeys I've used for brewing. Spend the money and get better stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Grady

customer_reviews.title: Too Sweet
customer_reviews.text: A little goes a long because this is naturally very sweet! It lasts a while too, even better!
customer_reviews.author: Ultimate-Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Do not use for mead
customer_reviews.text: This is not “pure honey”. Do not use this honey to brew with. Not US product, not pure honey.
customer_reviews.author: RC1

customer_reviews.title: Love the flavor.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying this honey. My husband really likes it so, it’s a winner for me also.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Owen

customer_reviews.title: Sweetly Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Got it today. Honey has lots of uses at my house. Arrived well shipped no leakage, and I got Honey! No complaints here
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I normally buy raw organic honey but was in a pinch. This is good honey at a great price. I will continue to use it for baking and adding to sauces.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I live honey and it is a better alternative to sugar. Healthy benefits besides the taste.
customer_reviews.author: LoveAllKindsOfGear

customer_reviews.text: Just now finishing what i bought 5 months ago and i use this every morning in my coffee. Great value. I get less than half a pound for pretty much the same price. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jshopper

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: Great for mead, toasts, and teas. I love honey. At this price, I can use it all I want.
customer_reviews.author: daniel grady

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be very good honey, excellent for the price. We use honey by-the-pound around here, so I was looking for a reasonably priced, high quality product -- THIS IS IT. We will be buying this again and again (as long as the price stays low).
customer_reviews.author: John A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good honey. Decent quality
customer_reviews.text: Good honey. Decent quality. I can however, get comparable quality honey at Wegman's or Costco for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Michawl1207

customer_reviews.title: Honey wasn't any thing special.  I found it turned to sugar too fast.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact it turns to sugar too fast. Don't know what process was used in packaging but it wasn't for me. My family raised bees and collected honey when I was growing up. Never had this sugar program so quickly. I have tried to cancel the "standing" order but cannot get it stopped. I have to remember to change ship date so I don't receive any more.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye F.

customer_reviews.title: Good tasting
customer_reviews.text: Good tasting honey not as strong as I was expecting. Jug came in slightly damaged but overall pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie Loverly

customer_reviews.title: Made a sick mead
customer_reviews.text: This stuff makes good mead. Very floral smelling, high quality. Ferments well too - in a month, lalvin 71B yeast took 15lbs of this stuff in 5 gallons from 1.113 to 1.012. This honey is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Symer

customer_reviews.title: Bee happy
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for the money. Tate is sweet and rich. Darker color. I bought 3 and it is consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Avid online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy On Honey
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this in my coffee - it is delicious and a good buy for 5 pounds. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: John R Wilsdon

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY THE BEST HONEY ONLINE
customer_reviews.text: We are an organic food household and only use honey. This honey is absolutely the best honey in the business and the price wins hands down for pureness over any store bought organic honey. The flavor is fresh from the hive with no "local" aftertaste. If I could give it more stars I would!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Balacaier

customer_reviews.title: Sweet honey.
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this honey for two years now (almost one each month) and my family loves its flavor and taste.
customer_reviews.author: Simeon M.Momanyi

customer_reviews.title: Yummy Honey
customer_reviews.text: The honey is very good. It's a darker honey that I'm used to buying at the grocery store. It has a 'earthy', almost woodsy flavor which I really enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: H F

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t taste like honey. Taste different. I think it’s okay. I’m going to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Eliz

customer_reviews.title: It was foul smelling and tasting.
customer_reviews.text: This honey tasted terrible! It was stale and smelled and tasted bad. I ended up pouring it all down the drain.😒
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Trudeau

customer_reviews.title: Not pure honey..
customer_reviews.text: This honey has a funny aftertaste. Like it was not pure raw honey. Not worth the $3 savings... Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Good Meade honey for the dollar
customer_reviews.text: Uaed to make mead 3 weeks in and so far I can tell its working well great value
customer_reviews.author: Larry J. Eustice

customer_reviews.title: Caps weren’t tight and one bottle leaked in box
customer_reviews.text: The flavor is great. Very excited to get the mead started would’ve given a 5, however the caps weren’t tightened down and one bottle of the two leaked into the packaging, only lost maybe 1/8 of the honey though. So overall with the price and error not but so disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Clae

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Second purchase. Very satisfied with the quality of this honey, makes for a perfect cup of green tea every time.
customer_reviews.author: Augnut

customer_reviews.title: Honey
customer_reviews.text: My work schedule is tight; I didn't have time to go to the grocery store so I order this bottle of honey. It was perfect! I need to reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Dimples

customer_reviews.title: this is good honey at a reasonable price. GET YOURS TODAY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yummy! and packed just right for travel into our higher elevation no mess in this package. AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quantity  & Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great Tasting Honey... Years ago I had some Dark Black Forest honey,, this Has a strong taste similar but not as Dark... Very nice! and the Big Bottle for a Good Price! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Dale Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Like honey
customer_reviews.text: This honey is good and starts to crystallize if you do not use it fast enough which makes me feel like this is not diluted..
customer_reviews.author: Ellen D zanetti

customer_reviews.title: Great Tasting  Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This honey has a nice flavor. The price is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: diannmc

customer_reviews.title: we love it, and so do the bees
customer_reviews.text: great price for a great honey; we use it in our coffee, for baking, and for soaps; we gave some to the bees outside and even they LOVED IT! You can't fool nature.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Maring

product_meta.title: Lake Shore Bulk Honey, 5 Lb
product_meta.description:
Size:5 Pound (Pack of 1)Lake Shore Bulk Honey, from HoneyTree, is perfect for restaurants, caterers, and home kitchens. This light amber honey is all-natural and True Source Certified, with a robust floral flavor. 

All of HoneyTree’s honey is U.S. Grade A — each large batch of honey goes through rigorous quality control and testing.
feature_bullets: Robust flavor drawn from multiple floral sources
Superb quality with a lasting shelf life
True Source Certified, ethically sourced, and traceable
Use for honey beer or mead, honey wheat bread, or other honey needs

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
